Key Match Events: Nick Martinez dominated the Brewers earlier this month with seven shutout innings.
Colin Rea had inconsistent performances in August, including seven shutout innings against Atlanta and Cleveland, but also giving up seven runs to the Dodgers and four runs to Oakland.
William Contreras and Willy Adames each hit solo home runs for the Brewers.
Sal Frelick hit a home run off Nick Martinez.
TJ Friedl made a notable catch after slamming into the wall.
Elly De La Cruz drove in Will Benson with a hit.
Nick Martinez allowed a home run to Sal Frelick.
The Reds had two outs on the base paths in the bottom of the 9th inning.
The Brewers won the game in extra innings.
Pre-Game Insights: The game is a makeup for a postponed game on April 11th.
First pitch for game one is scheduled for 12:40pm ET.
The game will be available to watch on MLB Network as well as Bally Sports Ohio.
Nick Martinez's splits show he performs better on the road with an ERA of 2.74 compared to 4.42 at home.
Colin Rea's splits show he allows more home runs at home (15) compared to on the road (7).
Post-Match Reflections: Hunter Greene has started throwing again and the team is working on a target date for his return this season.
The Reds made several roster moves, including calling up Rhett Lowder and Yosver Zulueta for the doubleheader.
Brandon Leibrandt was optioned to Louisville, and Davis Wendzel was designated for assignment.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Great American Ball Park with a forecast of 93° and sunny.
The Reds' playoff odds are 0.0% according to Fangraphs.
The Brewers' playoff odds are 99.2% according to Fangraphs.
